, responsible for managing resources and state required for reading from and/or writing to
objects. Maintains all buffer bindings, when swapping is eanbled, two binding objects are created for easy switching of all WebGL resource binginds.

, Optional) - key and value pairs, where key is the name of vertex shader varying and value is the corresponding
object or buffer params object. If a buffer params object is specified, it will contain following fields, these can be used to capture data into the buffer at particular offset and size.
=(Number, default: 0) - Byte offset that is used to start recording the data in the buffer.
=(Number, default: remaining buffer size) - Size in bytes that is used for recording the data.

, Optional) - key and value pairs, where key is the name of vertex shader varying and value is the corresponding

=(Number, default: 0) - Byte offset that is used to start recording the data in the buffer.

Returns current feedback buffer corresponding to given varying name.
Reads and returns data from current feedback buffer corresponding to the given varying name.

, Optional) - when specified, first checks if there is a corresponding feedback buffer, if so reads data from this buffer and returns. When not specified, there must be target texture and data is read from this texture and returned.
